channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Carmelo Anthony reflects on Hall of Fame career, investing wins and passing on Google and crypto: ‘That’s another one I should have went with my gut on’
item.description: The NBA legend talked to Fortune about his business career, his investments, NIL rights and more: "Now, I don't think these kids really enjoy that mom...

item.title: The most popular social media platform isn’t TikTok or X
item.description: Social media has become inexorably intertwined with our daily lives, but not all platforms are equally popular. For every cultural phenomenon like Tik...

item.title: Europe’s most popular sign of Christmas is a star that’s been handmade for over 180 years by one of the world’s oldest Protestant denominations
item.description: You already know the Moravian Star, even if you don't know where it's from or why it looks so distinctively beautiful.

item.title: A Dietician Explains Why You Shouldn’t Feel Guilty About Overeating During the Holidays
item.description: Go ahead and have that second slice of pie. Guilt around food is way worse for you than a couple of days of holiday overeating.

item.title: How OpenAI Ships New Products With Lightning Speed
item.description: OpenAI credits a tool system called Codex for its impressive shipping cadence. Here’s how they use it.

item.title: The Neuroscience of Black Friday Can Help You Shop Smarter (or Sell More Stuff)
item.description: Why has Black Friday spread to countries that know nothing about Thanksgiving? Because it’s a “masterclass in behavioral science.”

item.title: Two Gen Zers turned down millions from Elon Musk to build an AI based on the human brain—and it’s outperformed models from OpenAI and Anthropic
item.description: William Chen and Guan Wang believe they will be the first ones to build artificial general intelligence.

item.title: Black Friday design deals you don’t want to miss
item.description: After Thanksgiving, brands will bombard you with Black Friday and Cyber Monday promotions. It can be overwhelming to know what to buy. After all, some...

item.title: Neuroscience Just Explained Why Your Brain Believes Lies
item.description: There’s a fine line between healthy skepticism and self-defeating cynicism.

item.title: The anti-junk gift guide

item.title: AI is tranforming spacecraft propulsion—and may lead to nuclear-powered rockets

item.title: Here’s Why Stocks Can Rally Into 2026
item.description: The S&P 500 looks set up for a year-end boom.

item.title: Stanley McChrystal says leaders must have good character and strong convictions

item.title: Futures and Treasuries markets on CME black out overnight, after a glitch at an all-important data centre
item.description: "BrokerTec EU markets are open and trading. All other CME Group markets remain halted due to a data center cooling issue at CyrusOne," CME told Fortun...

item.title: I went to COP30—and saw how the rest of the world is pushing climate action even as the U.S. steps back
item.description: Amid the diplomatic gridlock, perhaps the real story of COP30 was happening outside the negotiation halls.
